column4: Can't seem to find my Wireless Connection under system Admin....any ideas to help me install this.
I need help with my Wireless Connection...
anybody have advise..??
Alan...I'm looking for help with my Wireless Connection....which I can seem to find under my "System" and "admin" menus...
Can't
UNbuntu...
Ubuntu...and no I haven't where is located..?
Fang...I just need to type that into a terminal..?
Fang...yes it is installed.........but all I can see is Ethernet and Fax Modem...Still NO wireless Connection....ummmm?
JOse.......alll i know is that I'm using "Ubuntu"...LOL
heh, run 'lsb_release -a' in a terminal, it'll tell you dapper or edgy
if it's dapper, run 'sudo aptitude install linux-686' (assuming you're in i386, not amd64), if it's edgy, run 'sudo aptitude install linux-generic'
sudo aptitude install linux-686
if you're on i386.  that should install a resticted modules package too
np's, try rebooting afterwards and (hopefully) your card should appear
if it's a supported card, that is ;)
if it's pcmcia it's roulette, if it doesn't work, https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper - you can use your windows drivers with that
okay ;) good luck!
any luck?
ack :( if it still isn't showing up even under 'iwconfig', it mustn't be supported
if you see an entry for a wireless card in 'iwconfig' though, 'sudo aptitude install network-manager-gnome' should be all you need
